docs.text:
OVERVIEW


This document defines a set of cloud APIs that can be used by third-party services to access and control Sengled smart lighting devices via cloud-to-cloud integration. Access to the API endpoints requires a third-party service to authenticate itself using the standard OAuth2.0 authentication mechanism. Once a third-party service has successfully obtained an access token, it will authenticate all calls to any API endpoint by including the encoded access token in the Authorization header. 


Please see the detail of OAuth2 process in the diagram below.




Here is the URL form used in Step 3.


http:// openapi_url//oauth2/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=testclient&redirect_uri= thirdpartner_url &scope=read&state=example


The response returned in Step 4 includes:


http://thirdpartner_url?code=b8ddea14-bad3-4181-b978-85c8ab9b9f44


An example of URL form used in Step 5 and Step 6 is as follows:


HTTP Request


Method
: POST


URL
: http:// openapi_url//oauth2/token


Headers
: {Authorization=[Basic dGVzdGNsaWVudDoyY2M3YTBiOS0yOGEzLTQ2NGMtYTAwMC02Nzg1YTRlMTI5OWE=], Content-Type=[application/x-www-form-urlencoded]}


Body
: {grant_type=[authorization_code], redirect_uri=[http:// thirdpartner_url], code=[0c4a4615-3ae0-499b-802d-d43474cf2dd1]}


HTTP Response Headers


Status
: 200


Headers
:{Date=[Fri, 16 Oct 2015 08:26:34 GMT], Transfer-Encoding=[chunked], Content-Type=[application/json], Server=[Apache-Coyote/1.1], Pragma=[no-cache], Cache-Control=[no-store, no-transform]}


HTTP Response Body


{"scope":"read","access_token":"46f8c0ac-3ff0-4a51-8dff-cf9835398044","token_type":"bearer","expires_in":30,"refresh_token":"e6f0e895-9555-4337-a320-88162e30c4a5"}
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: This document defines a set of cloud APIs that can be used by third-party services to access and control Sengled smart lighting devices via cloud-to-cloud integration. Access to the API endpoints requires a third-party service to authenticate itself using the standard OAuth2.0 authentication mechanism. Once a third-party service has successfully obtained an access token, it will authenticate all calls to any API endpoint by including the encoded access token in the Authorization header.   Please see the detail of OAuth2 process in the diagram below.   Here is the URL form used in Step 3.  http:// openapi_url//oauth2/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=testclient&redirect_uri= thirdpartner_url &scope=read&state=example  The response returned in Step 4 includes:  http://thirdpartner_url?code=b8ddea14-bad3-4181-b978-85c8ab9b9f44  An example of URL form used in Step 5 and Step 6 is as follows:  HTTP Request  Method : POST  URL : http:// openapi_url//oauth2/token  Headers : {Authorization=[Basic dGVzdGNsaWVudDoyY2M3YTBiOS0yOGEzLTQ2NGMtYTAwMC02Nzg1YTRlMTI5OWE=], Content-Type=[application/x-www-form-urlencoded]}  Body : {grant_type=[authorization_code], redirect_uri=[http:// thirdpartner_url], code=[0c4a4615-3ae0-499b-802d-d43474cf2dd1]}  HTTP Response Headers  Status : 200  Headers :{Date=[Fri, 16 Oct 2015 08:26:34 GMT], Transfer-Encoding=[chunked], Content-Type=[application/json], Server=[Apache-Coyote/1.1], Pragma=[no-cache], Cache-Control=[no-store, no-transform]}  HTTP Response Body  {"scope":"read","access_token":"46f8c0ac-3ff0-4a51-8dff-cf9835398044","token_type":"bearer","expires_in":30,"refresh_token":"e6f0e895-9555-4337-a320-88162e30c4a5"}
docs.title: OVERVIEW

docs.text:
RESPONSE


Response status Code


Responses from Sengled cloud will include HTTP status code and OpenAPI status code. OpenAPI status code supplements HTTP status code by providing more status details and/or more targeted error messages associated with specific product type. 


HTTP Status code








HTTP Code


Description










200


OK






400


Bad Request. The request is not properly formatted.






401


Unauthorized. API authentication failed.






404


The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI.






405


A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g.,using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).








Sengled Open API Status Code


Below is status code value description.


200:    Success


<200:   General errors


>200:  Error codes for Specific Sengled product module 


Return status data format：


{"code":200,"message":"success"}


General OpenAPI code list：








Code


Description










200


OK






100


Invalid or missing required parameter.






101


Operation failed.






102


Operation not supported.






103


No Permission






104


Invalid or expired access token






105


One or more device(s) doesn’t exist.






106


Other








Openapi error code list specific for Sengled Element module：








Code


Description










20602


hub offline






20604


Sengled bulb does not exist






20608


Bulb configuration failure






20610


is not paid service user








Device data object


The profile and settings of a Sengled smart device is represented as a data structure using the standard JSON format as follows.


{


"deviceList": [                             //bulb list


​       {


​         "propertyList": [


​           {


​             "property": "name",


​             "value": "ElementBulb007E"       //bulb name


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "brightness",


​             "value": "47"                    //bulb brightness:range(0-100)


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "switch",


​             "value": "on/off"                    //bulb power status


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "resolution",


​             "value": "360/720/1080"                    //camera resolution


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "isOnline",


​             "value": "true"                  //bulb online status 


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "microphone",


​             "value": "on/off"                  //microphone is enabled? 


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "motionDetection",


​             "value": "on/off"                  //motionDetection is enabled? 


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "nightVision",


​             "value": "auto/off"                  //nightVision is enabled? 


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "paidServiceActive",


​             "value": "true"                  //paidServiceActive is enabled? 


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "notification",


​             "value": "on/off"                  //notification is enabled? 


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "startTime",             //device activation time. 


​             "value": "2015-11-05 08:15:30"


​           }


​         ],


​         "product": "snap",              //product type   


​         "productSubType": "",


​         "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",      //device MAC address  


​       }


​     ]


​   }


Device data object parameters:








Name


Type


Description










deviceList


List


List of device data object






Property/value


{String/String}


Parameter name and value






product


String


Product type（element, snap…）






productSubType


String


Product subtype






deviceID


String


Device’s unique identifier








propertyList values：








Name


Type


Supported product type


Description










name


String


All


Device name






brightness


String


All


Dim level（0-100）






colorTemperature


String


Element


Color temperature（0-100）






Switch


String


All


Light switch status on/off






Power


String


Element


Wattage






totalHoursPoweredOn


String


Element


The number of hours that a device has been on.






powerOnCount


String


Element


The power on count






powerConsumption


String


Element


Total power consumption in Kwh






isOnline


String


All


Online status: true/false






startTime


String


All


UTC time at which a device is first activated.






resolution


String


Snap


Camera resolution（360/720/1080）






microphone


String


Snap


Microphone status  on／off






motionDetection


String


Snap


Is motion detection enabled? On/off






nightVision


String


Snap


Is night vision enabled? Auto/off






notification


String


Snap


Is motion notification enabled? On/Off






paidServiceActive


String


Snap


Paid service active? True/False






video


String


Snap


Is video enabled? On/off






parentDeviceID


String


Element


Hub id

API authentication failed.    404  The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI.    405  A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g.,using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).

docs.text: Code  Description      200  OK    100  Invalid or missing required parameter.    101  Operation failed.    102  Operation not supported.    103  No Permission    104  Invalid or expired access token    105  One or more device(s) doesn’t exist.    106  Other     Openapi error code list specific for Sengled Element module：     Code  Description      20602  hub offline    20604  Sengled bulb does not exist    20608  Bulb configuration failure    20610  is not paid service user
docs.title: General OpenAPI code list：

docs.text: The profile and settings of a Sengled smart device is represented as a data structure using the standard JSON format as follows.  {  "deviceList": [                             //bulb list  ​       {  ​         "propertyList": [  ​           {  ​             "property": "name",  ​             "value": "ElementBulb007E"       //bulb name  ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "brightness",  ​             "value": "47"                    //bulb brightness:range(0-100)  ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "switch",  ​             "value": "on/off"                    //bulb power status  ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "resolution",  ​             "value": "360/720/1080"                    //camera resolution  ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "isOnline",  ​             "value": "true"                  //bulb online status   ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "microphone",  ​             "value": "on/off"                  //microphone is enabled?   ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "motionDetection",  ​             "value": "on/off"                  //motionDetection is enabled?   ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "nightVision",  ​             "value": "auto/off"                  //nightVision is enabled?   ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "paidServiceActive",  ​             "value": "true"                  //paidServiceActive is enabled?   ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "notification",  ​             "value": "on/off"                  //notification is enabled?   ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "startTime",             //device activation time.   ​             "value": "2015-11-05 08:15:30"  ​           }  ​         ],  ​         "product": "snap",              //product type     ​         "productSubType": "",  ​         "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",      //device MAC address    ​       }  ​     ]  ​   }  Device data object parameters:     Name  Type  Description      deviceList  List  List of device data object    Property/value  {String/String}  Parameter name and value    product  String  Product type（element, snap…）    productSubType  String  Product subtype    deviceID  String  Device’s unique identifier     propertyList values：     Name  Type  Supported product type  Description      name  String  All  Device name    brightness  String  All  Dim level（0-100）    colorTemperature  String  Element  Color temperature（0-100）    Switch  String  All  Light switch status on/off    Power  String  Element  Wattage    totalHoursPoweredOn  String  Element  The number of hours that a device has been on.    powerOnCount  String  Element  The power on count    powerConsumption  String  Element  Total power consumption in Kwh    isOnline  String  All  Online status: true/false    startTime  String  All  UTC time at which a device is first activated.    resolution  String  Snap  Camera resolution（360/720/1080）    microphone  String  Snap  Microphone status  on／off    motionDetection  String  Snap  Is motion detection enabled? On/off    nightVision  String  Snap  Is night vision enabled? Auto/off    notification  String  Snap  Is motion notification enabled? On/Off    paidServiceActive  String  Snap  Paid service active? True/False    video  String  Snap  Is video enabled? On/off    parentDeviceID  String  Element  Hub id
docs.title: Device data object

docs.text:
OpenAPI Endpoint Description


· queryAll


Retrieve a complete list of Sengled devices and their parameter values belonging to the authenticated Sengled user account.


GET
 
https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/queryAll


Input parameters


None


Response


If success, a list of devices and their parameter values will be returned as a JSON device data object mentioned above. If failed, a JSON status code will issued as follows. 


Example: {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message


String


Detailed status message








· query


Query for device parameter values of a specified set of devices. 


POST
 
https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/query


Input parameters


A list of device’s product type and MAC address.


{   


​    "devices": [


​        {


​           " product ": "element",


​            " deviceID ": " B0:CE:18:08:00:01"


​        }


​    ]


}








Name


Description


Type


Required










deviceID


Device unique identifier


String


Yes






product


Product type


String


Yes








Response


If success, a list of devices and their parameter values will be returned as a JSON device data object mentioned above. If failed, a JSON status code will be issued as follows. 


Example: {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message


String


Detailed status message








· control


Adjust specified parameter settings for the specified device. 


POST
 https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/control


Input parameters


{


​    "product": "element",


​    "deviceID": "deviceID",


​    "propertyList": [


​        {


​            "property": "brightness",


​            "value": "0-100"


​        }


​    ]


}


Supported property names：








Name


Description


Supported product


Required


Data type


Valid values










deviceID


Device Unique ID


ALL


Yes


String


MAC address






Product


Product Type


All


Yes


String


snap，element, …






switch


Switch On/off state


ALL


No


String


off/on






brightness


Dim level


ALL


No


String


0-100






colorTemperature


Color temperature


Element


No


String


0-100






microphone


Microphone state


Snap


No


String


off/on






motionDetection


Is motion detection enabled?


Snap


No


String


off/on






notification


Is motion notification enabled?


Snap


No


String


off/on






nightVision


Is night vision enabled?


Snap


No


String


off/auto






resolution


Set camera resolution


Snap


No


String


360/720/1080






deviceReboot


Reboot firmware?


Snap


No


String


reboot






video


Is video streaming enabled?


Snap


No


String


off/on






snapshot


Take a snapshot?


Snap


No


String


true






audioOut


Start/stop audio from the cloud to the Snap.(This needs to be used together with getSpeakerURL


Snap


No


String


start/stop








Response status


If all the parameters are adjusted correctly, a success status code will be issued as follows.


{“code":”200”,"message":"success"}


Otherwise, an example of the following error code will be returned.


{“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message


String


Detailed status message








· register


Allows third party services to register for callback service that provides asynchronous device parameter changes and/or events.


POST
 
https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/register


Input parameters


{


​    "registerUrl": " https://callback_url",


​    "username": "callback username",


​    "password": "callback password"


}








Name


Description


Required


Data type










registerUrl


Callback URL


Yes


String






username


Callback username


No


String






password


Callback password


No


String








Response status


If registration is successful, a success status code will be issued as follows.


{“code":”200”,"message":"success"}


Otherwise, an example of the following error code will be returned.


{“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message


String


Detailed status message








· unregister


Allows third party services to unregister from callback service.


POST
 
https://https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/unregister


Input parameters


None


Response status


If de-registration is successful, a success status code will be issued as follows.


{“code":”200”,"message":"success"}


Otherwise, an example of the following error code will be returned.


{“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message


String


Detailed status message








· Call third party URL


Sengled API service will call third party URL with status changes or events.


POST
 " registerUrl "  


Input parameters


Http hearder: Authorization Header (HTTP Basic Authentication)


Basic encodeBase64("username "+":"+" password ")


Payload:


{


​    "propertyChangeList": [


{


"deviceID": "B0CE181400000333",


​           "product": "element",


​           "status": "online"


​        },


​        {


"deviceID": "B0CE181400000333",


​           "product": "element",


​           " status ": "offline"


​        },


​               {


​                       "product": "element",


​                       "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",


​                       "name": "B0CE18140aaaaaa"


​                },


​               {


​                       "product": "snap",


​                       "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",


​                        "switch": "on"


​                },


​                {


​                       "product": "snap",


​                       "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",


​                       " brightness ":"20"


​                },


​                {


​                       "product": "snap",


​                       "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",


​                       "resolution":"360"


​                },


{


​                       "product": "snap",


​                       "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",


​                       "microphone":"on/off"


​                },


​                {


​                       "product": "snap",


​                       "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",


​                       "motionDetection":"on/off"


​                },


​                {


​                       "product": "snap",


​                       "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",


​                       "nightVision":"auto/off"


​                },


​                {


​                       "product": "snap",


​                       "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",


​                       "notification": "on/off"


​                }


​           ] ,


"eventList": [


​        {


​           "deviceID": "B0CE181400000333",


​           "product": "snap",


​           "eventName": "add"


​        },


​        {


​            "deviceID": "B0CE181400000555",


​            "product": "snap",


​            "eventName": "delete"


​        },


​        {


​           "deviceID": "B0CE181400000555",


​          "product": "snap",


​          "eventName": "motion",


​          "snapshotUrl": "https://xxx.com/xxx.jpg",


​          "eventTime": "2015-11-05 08:15:30"


​        },


​       {


​           "deviceID": "B0CE181400000555",


​          "product": "snap",


​          "eventName": "snapshot",


​          "snapshotUrl": "https://xxx.com/xxx.jpg",


​          "eventTime": "2015-11-05 08:15:30"


​        }


]


"devices:"[


​        {


​            "product": "element",


​            "deviceID": "B0CE181400000223",


​            "parentDeviceID": "",


​            "brightness": "15",


​                "switch": "on"


"colorTemperature": "15",


"power": "15",


​            "name": "Dave's bulb",


​            "action": "added"


​        },


​        {


​            "product": "element",


​            "deviceID": "B0CE181400000223",


​            "parentDeviceID": "",


​            "action": "deleted"


​        }


​    ]


}








Name


Description


Product supported


Required


Data type


Valid values










deviceID


Device Unique ID


All


Yes


String


MAC address






product


Product Type


All


Yes


String


snap, element, …






name


Device nickname


All

String








switch

ALL

ALL

0-100

Snap

Snap

All

Online/offline/Add/delete/Motion/Snapshot (snap only)

URL containing snapshots


Snap


No

URL link address






eventTime


Event time


All


No


String


UTC time








Response status


None


· getPlaybackClips


Query for video playback clips.（snap only）


POST https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/getPlaybackClips


Input parameters


​   {


​       "product": "snap",   //product type


​       "deviceID": "deviceID",  //deviceID


​       "startDateTime":"2015-11-05T08:15:30Z",  //UTC


​       "endDateTime":"2015-11-05T08:16:30Z"     //UTC


​   }








Type


Description


Supported product


Required


Data type


Valid values










deviceID


Unique device identifier


Snap


Yes


String


MAC address






Product


Product type


Snap


Yes


String


snap，element, …






startDateTime


Starting time


Snap


Yes


String


UTC






endDateTime


End time


Snap


Yes


String


UTC








Response


A plackback list containing video clips will be provided if successful.


{


​    "playbackList": [


​        {


​            "playbackUrl": "https://videostore.com/xxx.mp4",


​            "startDateTime": "2015-11-05T08:15:30Z",


​            "length": "300"


​        },


​        {


​            "playbackUrl": "https://videostore.com/xxx.mp4",


​            "startDateTime": "2015-11-05T08:15:30Z",


​            "length": "300"


​        }


​    ]


}








Name


Type


Supported product


Description










playbackUrl


String


Snap


Playback URL






startDateTime


String


Snap


Desired playback start time in UTC






length


String


Snap


Length of the playback clips. (in second)








Otherwise, a failure status code will be issued:


{“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message

· getLiveVideoURL


Query for live streaming URL (snap only).


​   
POST
 
https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/getLiveVideoURL


Input parameters


{

}

}

Otherwise, a failure status code will be issued:


Failure return


{“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type

code

See Status code list for detailed code

· getSnapshots


Query for camera snapshot list (snap only).


POST

Input parameters

· getSpeakerURL


This endpoint allows third-party service to acquire the RTSP link for playing audio into the Snap speaker.


Note
:


After such a RTSP connection is connected, please invoke the openAPI endpoint device: audioOut to start and stop audio streaming into the Snap speaker. 


POST
 https://base_url/openapi/att/api/v1/getSpeakerURL 


Input parameters


{

​    "roiAreaCoordinate": "20,30,20,20"


},

​    "zoneName": "zone2", 


​    "roiAreaCoordinate": "20,30,20,20"

]

docs.text: Retrieve a complete list of Sengled devices and their parameter values belonging to the authenticated Sengled user account.  GET   https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/queryAll  Input parameters  None  Response  If success, a list of devices and their parameter values will be returned as a JSON device data object mentioned above. If failed, a JSON status code will issued as follows.   Example: {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}     Parameter name  Type  Description      code  String  See Status code list for detailed code    message  String  Detailed status message

If failed, a JSON status code will be issued as follows.   Example: {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}     Parameter name  Type  Description      code  String  See Status code list for detailed code    message  String  Detailed status message

POST  https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/control  Input parameters  {  ​    "product": "element",  ​    "deviceID": "deviceID",  ​    "propertyList": [  ​        {  ​            "property": "brightness",  ​            "value": "0-100"  ​        }  ​    ]  }  Supported property names：     Name  Description  Supported product  Required  Data type  Valid values      deviceID  Device Unique ID  ALL  Yes  String  MAC address    Product  Product Type  All  Yes  String  snap，element, …    switch  Switch On/off state  ALL  No  String  off/on    brightness  Dim level  ALL  No  String  0-100    colorTemperature  Color temperature  Element  No  String  0-100    microphone  Microphone state  Snap  No  String  off/on    motionDetection  Is motion detection enabled?  Snap  No  String  off/on    notification  Is motion notification enabled?  Snap  No  String  off/on    nightVision  Is night vision enabled?  Snap  No  String  off/auto    resolution  Set camera resolution  Snap  No  String  360/720/1080    deviceReboot  Reboot firmware?  Snap  No  String  reboot    video  Is video streaming enabled?  Snap  No  String  off/on    snapshot  Take a snapshot?  Snap  No  String  true    audioOut  Start/stop audio from the cloud to the Snap.(This needs to be used together with getSpeakerURL  Snap  No  String  start/stop     Response status  If all the parameters are adjusted correctly, a success status code will be issued as follows.  {“code":”200”,"message":"success"}  Otherwise, an example of the following error code will be returned.  {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}     Parameter name  Type  Description      code  String  See Status code list for detailed code    message  String  Detailed status message

docs.text: This endpoint allows a third-party service to delete the specified motion zones.  POST   https://base_url/openapi/att/api/v1/deleteMotionZone    Input parameters  {  ​    "product": "snap",  "deviceID": "deviceID"  motionZoneList:[  {   ​    "zoneId": “1”,   },  {   ​    "zoneId": “2”,   }  ]  }     Type  Description  Supported product  Required  Data type  Valid values      deviceID  Device unique identifier  Snap  Yes  String  MAC address    product  Device product  Snap  Yes  String  snap，element, …    zoneId  Id of zone  Snap  No  String      Return status  If all the zones are deleted successfully, a success status code will be issued as follows:  {"success":"true"}  Otherwise, an example of the following error code will be returned.  {“errorCode":”20”,"errorMsg":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}     Parameter Name  Type  Description      errorCode  String  See Status code list for detailed code    errorMsg  String  Detailed status message
docs.title: · deleteMotionZones

docs.text: Retrieve a point list belonging to the authenticated Sengled user account.  GET  https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/point  Input parameters  None  Response  If success, a point list will be returned as a JSON data. If failed, a JSON status code will issued as follows.   {  ​    "pointList": [  ​        {  ​            "point": "1000",  ​            "endDateTime": "2015-11-05T08:15:30Z",  ​            "from": "element"  ​        },  ​        {  ​            "point": "500",  ​            "endDateTime": "2016-11-05T08:15:30Z",  ​            "from": "snap"  ​        }  ​    ]  }     Type  Description  Supported product  Required  Data type  Valid values      point  The sore of user  All  Yes  String  number    endDateTime  Date of the latest integration  All  Yes  String  Date    from  Point source  All  No  String  Product code..     Otherwise, a failure status code will be issued:  Example: {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}     Parameter name  Type  Description      code  String  See Status code list for detailed code    message  String  Detailed status message
docs.title: · point

docs.text: consume point belonging to the authenticated Sengled user account.  POST   https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/consume  Input parameters  {  "point": "1000",  "from": "element"  }     Type  Description  Supported product  Required  Data type  Valid values      point  The sore of user  All  Yes  String  number    from  Point source  All  No  String  Product code..     Response  If registration is successful, a success status code will be issued as follows.  {“code":”200”,"message":"success"}  Otherwise, a failure status code will be issued :  Example: {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}     Parameter name  Type  Description      code  String  See Status code list for detailed code    message  String  Detailed status message
docs.title: · consume

docs.text: Retrieve user information which belonging to the authenticated Sengled user account.  GET  https://base_url/openapi/api/v1/userinfo  Input parameters  None  Response  If success, user info will be returned as a JSON data. If failed, a JSON status code will issued as follows.   {  ​    "userInfo": [  ​        {  ​            "property": "userID",  ​            "value": "xxx@sengled.com"  ​        }  ​    ]  }     Type  Description  Supported product  Required  Data type  Valid values      userID  The email address  All  Yes  String  Xxx@sengled.com     Otherwise, a failure status code will be issued:  Example: {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}     Parameter name  Type  Description      code  String  See Status code list for detailed code    message  String  Detailed status message
docs.title: · userinfo

docs.text: Adjust specified parameter settings for the specified device.   POST  https://base_url/openapi/aws/api/v1/control  Input parameters  {  ​    "product": "element",  ​    "deviceName": " deviceName",  ​    "propertyList": [  ​        {  ​            "property": "brightness",  ​            "value": "0-100"  ​        }  ​    ]  }  Supported property names：     Name  Description  Supported product  Required  Data type  Valid values      deviceName  Device Name  ALL  Yes  String  String    Product  Product Type  All  Yes  String  snap，element, …    switch  Switch On/off state  ALL  No  String  off/on    brightness  Dim level  ALL  No  String  0-100    colorTemperature  Color temperature  Element  No  String  0-100    controlType  Control Type  Element  No  String  increaseBrightness/reduceBrightness/increaseColorTemperature/reduceColorTemperature    range  Range  Element  No  String  0-100     Response status  If all the parameters are adjusted correctly, a success status code will be issued as follows.  {“code":”200”,"message":"success"}  Otherwise, an example of the following error code will be returned.  {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}     Parameter name  Type  Description      code  String  See Status code list for detailed code    message  String  Detailed status message
docs.title: · aws echo control(One)

docs.text: Adjust specified parameter settings for the specified device.   POST  https://base_url/openapi/aws/api/v1/control  Input parameters  {  ​    "product": "element",  ​    "deviceID": " deviceID",  ​    "propertyList": [  ​        {  ​            "property": "brightness",  ​            "value": "0-100"  ​        }  ​    ]  }  Supported property names：     Name  Description  Supported product  Required  Data type  Valid values      deviceID  Device unique identifier  Snap  Yes  String  MAC address    Product  Product Type  All  Yes  String  snap，element, …    switch  Switch On/off state  ALL  No  String  off/on    brightness  Dim level  ALL  No  String  0-100    colorTemperature  Color temperature  Element  No  String  0-100    controlType  Control Type  Element  No  String  increaseBrightness/reduceBrightness/increaseColorTemperature/reduceColorTemperature    range  Range  Element  No  String  0-100     Response status  If all the parameters are adjusted correctly, a success status code will be issued as follows.  {“code":”200”,"message":"success"}  Otherwise, an example of the following error code will be returned.  {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}     Parameter name  Type  Description      code  String  See Status code list for detailed code    message  String  Detailed status message
